components.description: A single human ear. May be used in the context of listening, or hearing something.
components.title: Ear

description: A single human ear. May be used in the context of listening, or hearing something.
title: Ear

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Facial parts symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A single humanÂ ear. MayÂ be used in the context of listening, or hearing something. Ear was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added http://emojipedia.org/ear/
emoji_net_data.name: ear

bn:00089277v: To perceive sounds through the ear.
To perceive sound with the ear, without necessarily paying attention to it.

bn:00043373n: Listening is the act of hearing something and paying attention to what is heard.
Listening is often confused with hearing.
The act by which something is heard.

bn:00029372n: The organ of hearing, consisting of the pinna, auditory canal, eardrum, malleus, incus, stapes and cochlea.
The ear is the organ that detects sound.
The two ears of a human being considered as a whole.
The sense organ for hearing and equilibrium

bn:00000986n: The travelling of acoustic waves in the atmosphere with a speed independent of their amplitude. The speed only depends on the acoustic medium and is proportional to the square root of the absolute temperature for any given medium.
Sound is the vibration of matter, as perceived by the sense of hearing.
The longitudinal wave of pressure that is transmitted through any plastic material; audible sound.
Acoustic waves are a type of longitudinal waves that propagate by means of adiabatic compression and decompression.
A sensation perceived by the ear caused by the vibration of air or some other medium.
Mechanical wave that is an oscillation of pressure transmitted through a solid, liquid, or gas, composed of frequencies within the range of hearing
In physics, sound is a vibration that propagates as a typically audible mechanical wave of pressure and displacement, through a medium such as air or water.
Longitudinal wave of pressure transmitted through any plastic material.
Auditory sensation produced by the oscillations, stress, pressure, particle displacement, and particle velocity in a medium with internal forces; pressure variation that the human ear can detect.
The physical signal perceived by the auditory system.

bn:00007120n: Hearing is the ability to perceive sound by detecting vibrations through an organ such as the ear.
The general perceptual behaviour and the specific responses made in relation to sound stimuli.
The sense by which sound is perceived
The sense used to perceive sound.
The total of measures and devices implemented to preserve persons from harm to the faculty of perceiving sound.
Sensory perception of sound by living organisms
Hearing, auditory perception, or audition is the ability to perceive sound by detecting vibrations, changes in the pressure of the surrounding medium through time, through an organ such as the ear.
The ability to hear; the auditory faculty

apple_vendor_description: The ear emoji on Apple devices is rendered with exquisite detail, showcasing a soft, rounded form with subtle shading that mimics realistic human anatomy.  Its smooth gradients and gentle highlights give it a tactile appearance, suggesting the ability to hear and listen.  This emoji is often used to indicate that someone is paying attention, has heard something important, or to ask for clarification.
